alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:23AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Pine and central Burnett Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 222 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Grantsburg, or 12 miles southeast of Hinckley, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Siren and Webster around 255 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Falun, Saint Croix State Park, Alpha, Phantom Lake, Big Sand Lake, Cloverdale, Oakland, Birch Island Lake, Beroun and Yellow Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
